org.apache.river.test.spec.discoveryservice.event

Class DiscardUnreachable

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.river.qa.harness.QATestEnvironment
      • org.apache.river.test.spec.discoveryservice.AbstractBaseTest
        • org.apache.river.test.spec.discoveryservice.event.DiscardUnreachable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Test, TestEnvironment

    public class DiscardUnreachable
extends AbstractBaseTest
    This class verifies that the lookup discovery service operates in a manner consistent with the specification. In particular, this class verifies that the lookup discovery service can successfully employ both the multicast and unicast discovery protocols on behalf of one or more clients registered with that service to discover a number of pre-determined lookup services and then, for each discovered lookup service, send to the appropriate registration listener, the appropriate remote event containing the set of member groups with which the discovered lookup service was configured. The environment in which this class expects to operate is as follows:

    • one or more lookup services, each belonging to a finite set of member groups
    • one instance of the lookup discovery service
    • one or more registrations with the lookup discovery service
    • each registration with the lookup discovery service requests that some of the lookup services be discovered through only group discovery, some through only locator discovery, and some through both group and locator discovery
    • each registration with the lookup discovery service will receive remote discovery events through an instance of RemoteEventListener

    If the lookup discovery service utility functions as specified, then for each discovered lookup service, a RemoteDiscoveryEvent instance indicating a discarded event will be sent to the listener of each registration for each un-reachable lookup service.

      Test construct(QAConfig config)
      Performs actions necessary to prepare for execution of the current test (refer to the description of this method in the parent class).
      void run()
      Executes the current test by doing the following: registers with the lookup discovery service, requesting the discovery of the the desired lookup services using the desired discovery protocol verifies that the discovery process is working by waiting for the expected discovery events stops the multicast announcements being sent from each lookup service, and destroys the corresponding lookup service attempts to interact with each lookup service, invoking the discard() method on each registration upon finding that the lookup service is un-reachable verifies that the lookup discovery service utility under test sends the expected number of events - containing the expected set of member groups

      • run

        public void run()
         throws Exception
        Executes the current test by doing the following:

        • registers with the lookup discovery service, requesting the discovery of the the desired lookup services using the desired discovery protocol
        • verifies that the discovery process is working by waiting for the expected discovery events
        • stops the multicast announcements being sent from each lookup service, and destroys the corresponding lookup service
        • attempts to interact with each lookup service, invoking the discard() method on each registration upon finding that the lookup service is un-reachable
        • verifies that the lookup discovery service utility under test sends the expected number of events - containing the expected set of member groups
        Specified by:
        run in interface Test
        Specified by:
        run in class AbstractBaseTest
        Throws:
        Exception - if the test fails for any reason
